line.comment: * Task 0.
* This fleet is an attack fleet. Here are its targets:
* 1/ Jump Beacons and Advanced Satellites in sectors [OWNER] claims, + adjacent sectors, except Unknown. And also in [OWNER] sectors claimed by another race.
* 2/ Hostile ships in sectors [OWNER] claims. We don't defend, Border Patrol and Rearguard are here for that.
* 3/ Reprisal. Whenever a Task Force kills a ship, its RelValue is added to a global var (mayhem_reprisals). If this value is > 0, this Task Force will try to balance things out.
* 4/ Jump Beacons and Advanced Satellites in all [OWNER] reachable sectors, if the race is hostile.
* 5/ Random chance of targetting enemy freighters in [OWNER] reachable sectors.
* Zero Hour: during the global alliance only supporting OCV hunters (strong Rearguards)
* do if [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.Squadron.SwitchLeaderIfNeeded' : squadron=[THIS]
* continue
* we join the closest OCV Hunter squadron (can be from another faction)
* Zero Hour AI: -1=full defense ; 0=cautious ; 1=baseline (vanilla Mayhem 3) ; 2=confident ; 3=reckless
* if our Battlegroups need to be more defensive we can take over and conquer empty sectors which are adjacent to our territory
* If the sector was empty, or Unknown, it's best to stay in the area for a while.
* Return home if we were in mission.
* Satellites and jump beacons in adjacent sectors of any claimed sectors, + Enemies in [OWNER] claimed sectors.
* Enemies in sectors we claim.
* Also consider Player.
* Reprisals.
* Not calculating precisely the amount of remaining reprisal allows [OWNER] to generate more reprisals to $ship.owner (and create a spiral).
* Hostile sats and beacons in [OWNER] territory.
* Random hostile freighters in [OWNER] territory.
* Let's go in places we are not expected.

sval.val: Escorting %s
Opportunistic claim on %s
Defending %s
Attacking %s
Defending %s
Attacking %s
Defending %s
Going home
Task 0.
This fleet is an attack fleet. Here are its targets:
1/ Jump Beacons and Advanced Satellites in sectors [OWNER] claims, + adjacent sectors, except Unknown. And also in [OWNER] sectors claimed by another race.
2/ Hostile ships in sectors [OWNER] claims. We don't defend, Border Patrol and Rearguard are here for that.
3/ Reprisal. Whenever a Task Force kills a ship, its RelValue is added to a global var (mayhem_reprisals). If this value is > 0, this Task Force will try to balance things out.
4/ Jump Beacons and Advanced Satellites in all [OWNER] reachable sectors, if the race is hostile.
5/ Random chance of targetting enemy freighters in [OWNER] reachable sectors.
Zero Hour: during the global alliance only supporting OCV hunters (strong Rearguards)
do if [NULL]-> call script 'Mayhem.Squadron.SwitchLeaderIfNeeded' : squadron=[THIS]
we join the closest OCV Hunter squadron (can be from another faction)
Zero Hour AI: -1=full defense ; 0=cautious ; 1=baseline (vanilla Mayhem 3) ; 2=confident ; 3=reckless
if our Battlegroups need to be more defensive we can take over and conquer empty sectors which are adjacent to our territory
If the sector was empty, or Unknown, it's best to stay in the area for a while.
Return home if we were in mission.
Satellites and jump beacons in adjacent sectors of any claimed sectors, + Enemies in [OWNER] claimed sectors.
Enemies in sectors we claim.
Also consider Player.
Not calculating precisely the amount of remaining reprisal allows [OWNER] to generate more reprisals to $ship.owner (and create a spiral).
Hostile sats and beacons in [OWNER] territory.
Random hostile freighters in [OWNER] territory.
Let's go in places we are not expected.
